snippet: In the days after Hurricane Sandy, as large parts of New York City had gone dark from blackouts, the hunt was on for looters, and the police were not the only ones on the lookout.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column notes that in days following Hurricane Sandy, with large swaths of city dark from blackouts, New Yorkers posted plenty of warnings on their homes and businesses warning looters they would face dire consequences if caught.
lead_paragraph: In the days after Hurricane Sandy, as large parts of New York City had gone dark from blackouts, the hunt was on for looters, and the police were not the only ones on the lookout.

headline.seo: Chasing a Post-Storm Boogeyman Through Neighborhoods Gone Dark
headline.main: Chasing a Post-Storm Bogeyman Through Neighborhoods Gone Dark
headline.print_headline: Chasing a Post-Storm Boogeyman Through Neighborhoods Gone Dark
